com.gembox.spreadsheet.charts

Class ChartDataLabels

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.charts.ChartDataLabels

  • public final class ChartDataLabels
extends Object
    Represents the settings for the data labels for an entire series or the entire chart.

      • getNumberFormat

        public String getNumberFormat()
        Gets the number format used for formatting data labels. If isNumberFormatLinkedToSource() is true, then number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels.
        Returns:
        The number format used for formatting data labels.

      • isNumberFormatLinkedToSource

        public boolean isNumberFormatLinkedToSource()
        Gets a value indicating whether number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels.

        Default value of this field is true.

        Returns:
        true if number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels; otherwise, false.

      • isShowLeaderLines

        public boolean isShowLeaderLines()
        Gets a value indicating whether leader lines should be shown for data labels.
        Returns:
        true if leader lines should be shown for data labels; otherwise, false.

      • setLabelPosition

        public void setLabelPosition(DataLabelPosition labelPosition)
        Sets the position of the data label.

      • setNumberFormat

        public void setNumberFormat(String numberFormat)
        Sets the number format used for formatting data labels. If isNumberFormatLinkedToSource() is true, then number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels. Setting this field, sets setNumberFormatLinkedToSource(boolean) to false.
        Parameters:
        numberFormat - The number format used for formatting data labels.

      • setNumberFormatLinkedToSource

        public void setNumberFormatLinkedToSource(boolean numberFormatLinkedToSource)
        Sets a value indicating whether number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels.

        Default value of this field is true.

        Parameters:
        numberFormatLinkedToSource - true if number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format data labels; otherwise, false.

      • setSeparator

        public void setSeparator(String separator)
        Sets the text that should be used to separate the parts of a data label.
        Parameters:
        separator - The text that should be used to separate the parts of a data label.

      • setShowLeaderLines

        public void setShowLeaderLines(boolean showLeaderLines)
        Sets a value indicating whether leader lines should be shown for data labels.
        Parameters:
        showLeaderLines - true if leader lines should be shown for data labels; otherwise, false.

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows the value in the data label.

      • show

        public void show(DataLabelPosition labelPosition)

        Shows the value in the data label at the specified position.

        ColumnChart and BarChart support DataLabelPosition.CENTER, DataLabelPosition.INSIDE_END, DataLabelPosition.INSIDE_BASE and DataLabelPosition.OUTSIDE_END data label positions.

        LineChart supports DataLabelPosition.CENTER, DataLabelPosition.LEFT, DataLabelPosition.RIGHT, DataLabelPosition.TOP and DataLabelPosition.BOTTOM data label positions.

        PieChart supports DataLabelPosition.CENTER, DataLabelPosition.INSIDE_END, DataLabelPosition.OUTSIDE_END and DataLabelPosition.BEST_FIT data label positions.

        AreaChart supports none of the data label positions. Use show() overload for AreaChart instead.

        Parameters:
        labelPosition - The position of the label.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - The specified labelPosition is not supported for this chart.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this ChartDataLabels instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A String that represents this ChartDataLabels instance.
